What was contested as one of the events in Men's Artistic Gymnastics at the 1938 Summer Olympics?

context: In tumbling, <b4_0>athletes perform <a0_0>an explosive series of flips and twists down a sprung tumbling track<b4_0/><a0_0/>. Scoring is similar to trampolining. <b8_0>Tumbling<b8_0/> was originally contested as one of the events in Men's Artistic Gymnastics at the <a1_0>1932<a1_0/> Summer Olympics, and in <b5_0>1955<b5_0/> and 1959 at the Pan American Games. From 1974 to 1998 it was included as an event for both genders at the Acrobatic Gymnastics World Championships. The event has also been contested since <b7_0>1976<b7_0/> at the Trampoline World Championships. Since the recognition of Trampoline and Acrobatic Gymnastics as FIG disciplines in <a3_0>1999<a3_0/>, <b6_0>official Tumbling competitions are <a2_0>only allowed as an event in Trampoline gymnastics meets<b6_0/><a2_0/>.
